newsitem.title: USA: Culligan buys interest in Argentine water bottler.
newsitem.headline: Culligan buys interest in Argentine water bottler.

text.p: Culligan Water Technologies Inc said Monday it acquired a 51 percent interest in Sparkling SA, a bottled water company based in Buenos Aires, Argentina, for about $19.5 million.
Culligan said it also agreed to purchase the remaining 49 percent over a two-year period at a purchase price based on Sparkling's earnings.
Doug Pertz, Culligan president, said the acquisition is expected to be accretive to earnings.
"In addition, we anticipate further activity in this market as we continue to look for opportunities to expand Culligan's presence in South America and other areas of the world," Pertz said.
Sparkling is Argentina's leading five-gallon bottled water company with 44 percent of the market. Sparkling expects to report net sales of over $15 million for the year ended March 31, Culligan said.

"The acquisition of Sparkling is the first step in Culligan's expansion efforts in Latin America," Kenneth Wellings, Culligan Group President - International, said in a statement. "We see significant growth opportunities in this market for the full line of Culligan products as economies have stabilized and a pattern of strong growth has been achieved."
Culligan manufactures and distributes water purification and treatment products for retail, household, bottled water, commercial and industrial applications.
